description: Let p1, p2 be first pair of consecutive primes with difference 2n; let p3, p4 be 2nd such pair; sequence gives "wadi" value p3-p1.
references: Enoch Haga, Exploring Prime Numbers on Your PC, 2nd edition, 1998, ISBN 1-885794-16-9, Table 5, pp. 40-41.
example: First consecutive prime pair having difference 60 is p1=43331, p2=43391; next is p3=102701, p4=102761; so a(30)=102701-43331=59370.
crossrefs: Cf. A038460, A038343. a(i)=b(i)-c(i) where b(i) is A046789 and c(i) is A000230.
author: _Enoch Haga_
